titles.title: Nuclear Emergency Assurance Reform Act of 1999

To require the Nuclear Regulatory Commission to require applicants for or holders of operating licenses for nuclear power reactors to have in effect an emergency response plan for an area within a 50 mile radius of the reactor.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Power.

bill.summary: 3/11/1999--Introduced. Nuclear Emergency Assurance Reform Act of 1999 - Directs the Nuclear Regulatory Commission to revise regulations applicable to applicants for, or holders of, initial or renewed operating licenses for nuclear power reactors so that such applicants or holders will have to have in effect emergency response plans for an area within a 50-mile radius of such reactors which provide a reasonable assurance that adequate protective measures can and will be taken in the event of a radiological emergency.
